      • PieceMakerApi

        public PieceMakerApi(java.lang.Object context,
             java.lang.String host,
             java.lang.String api_key)
        Contructor (default)
        Parameters:
        context - A context for the callbacks / -errors
        host - A host fully qualified like: "http://localhost:3000"
        api_key - An api_key that comes with your user account for a PM2 instance

    • Method Detail

      • login

        public void login(java.lang.String userEmail,
         java.lang.String userPassword,
         ApiCallback callback)
        login()

        No API_KEY required

        If the user has no API key, this will generate one and it will be used for any further calls.

        Parameters:
        userEmail - The users email as contained in the database
        userPassword - The users password as contained in the database
        callback - A callback to be run once user is logged in

        The callback returns the users API key as String

        See Also:
        createCallback( Object[] args )

      • logout

        public void logout(ApiCallback callback)
        logout() Logging out does currently not make sense in the API (as there are no sessions), so this does actually nothing.
        Parameters:
        callback - A callback to be run once the logout is done
        See Also:
        createCallback( Object[] args )

        public void listUsers(ApiCallback callback)
        listUsers()
        Parameters:
        callback - A callback to be run once groups become available

        The callback returns an array of User objects

        See Also:

      • whoAmI

        public void whoAmI(ApiCallback callback)
        whoAmI()

        Get User object of the currently logged in user as determined by the API key in use.

        Parameters:
        callback - The callback to run when the user data becomes available

        The callback returns an User object for the currently logged in user

        See Also:
        createCallback( Object[] args ), User

      • createUser

        public void createUser(java.lang.String userName,
              java.lang.String userEmail,
              java.lang.String userRoleName,
              ApiCallback callback)
        createUser()

        Creates a new user from a name, email address and user role name. A password will be autogenerated and returned through the callback.

        Parameters:
        userName - A (display) name for this user
        userEmail - An email address for this user (can be fake)
        userRoleName - A global role for the user from the list of listRoles()
        callback - The callback to run when the user data becomes available

        The callback returns an User object for the new user including an autogenerated password

        See Also:
        Role, listRoles( ApiCallback callback ), createCallback( Object[] args ), User

      • getUser

        public void getUser(int userId,
           ApiCallback callback)
        getUser()

        Returns a User object, note that passwords are always omitted

        Parameters:
        userId - The id of the user to fetch
        callback - A callback to be run once user data is available
        See Also:
        User, createCallback( Object[] args )

      • updateUser

        public void updateUser(int userId,
              java.lang.String userName,
              java.lang.String userEmail,
              java.lang.String userRoleName,
              boolean disable,
              boolean renew_password,
              ApiCallback callback)
        updateUser()
        Parameters:
        userId - The id of the user to update
        userName - A display user name
        userEmail - An email address for the user (can be fake)
        userRoleName - A global role for the user as returned by listRoles()
        disable - A flag to enable or disable an user account
        renew_password - A flag to have the password be renewed (and then returned)
        callback - A callback to be run once the user data becomes available

        The callback returns a new User object reflecting the updated account

        See Also:
        Role, listRoles( ApiCallback callback ), User, createCallback( Object[] args )

      • deleteUser

        public void deleteUser(int userId,
              ApiCallback callback)
        deleteUser()

        All groups and events created by the user account will be set to "null"

        Parameters:
        userId - The id of the user account to delete
        See Also:
        createCallback( Object[] args )

      • listEventsWithFields

        public void listEventsWithFields(java.lang.Object... args)
        listEventsWithFields()
        Parameters:
        args - First arg is expected to be the (int) group id, then none or more pairs of (String) id, (String) value for the fields to look for, then a (ApiCallback) callback

        The callback receives an array of Event objects

        See Also:
        Event, createCallback( Object[] args )

      • listEventsForTimespan

        public void listEventsForTimespan(int groupId,
                         java.util.Date from,
                         java.util.Date to,
                         java.lang.String method,
                         ApiCallback callback)
        Load events by timespan
        Parameters:
        groupId - The id of the group to list events of
        from - A Date object for the left side / start of the timespan. Passing "null" denotes "beginning of time"
        to - A Date object for the right side / end of the timespan. Passing "null" says "until forever"
        method - One of TIMESTAMP, INTERSECTING, CONTAINED

        The callback receives an array of Event objects

        See Also:
        Event, createCallback( Object[] args )

      • findEvents

        public void findEvents(int groupId,
              java.util.HashMap query,
              ApiCallback callback)
        Find all events for given parameters
        Parameters:
        groupId - The id of a group to look for events in
        query - A query that can contain all of: type, from, to, method, fields
        callback - The callback to be run once events become available

        The callback receives an array of Event objects

        See Also:
        Event, createCallback( Object[] args )

                       java.lang.String name,

                       ApiCallback callback)
        addPermissionToRole()
        Parameters:
        roleName - The name / id of the role to add a permission to
        name - The name / entity of the permission to add
        permission - Either "allow" or "forbid"
        callback - A callback to run once the permissions are available

        The callback receives a Permission object

        See Also:

      • getSystemTime

        public void getSystemTime(ApiCallback callback)
        Get the server's system time.

        Remember that the HTTP communication will add to this.

        Requires no API_KEY

        Parameters:
        callback - The callback to run when the data becomes available
        See Also:
        createCallback( Object[] args )

      • createCallback

        public ApiCallback createCallback(java.lang.Object... args)
        Create a callback to be called with results from API

        There are several ways to use this:

        Given only a String it will use Java reflection to look up that method by name inside context as passed into the PieceMakerApi constructor

        Given an Object and a String it will use Java reflection to look up that method by name inside the given Object

        Any additional parameters are added to the method call after the parameters that the API returns by default: createCallback( context, "myMethod", arg1, arg2 ) will attempt to call: context.myMethod( apiResult, arg1, arg2 )

        Parameters:
        args - Varargs as explained above
        Returns:
        A callable object
